definition: Ming tombs in Nanjing, tomb of founding Ming emperor Zhu Yuanzhang 朱元璋[Zhu1 Yuan2 zhang1], a World Heritage site
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
filial piety or obedience/mourning apparel
mound/tomb/hill/mountain

sentences.english: Apart from, Shisanling, the most famous Ming Tomb is Xiaoling, located in the suburbs of Nanjing.
sentences.chinese: 十三陵之外最著名的明陵是坐落於南京市郊的明孝陵。

sentences.english: Why is there a Ming tomb here?
sentences.chinese: 怎麼這裏又有明孝陵呢？

sentences.english: The Square City is the symbolic building of the Ming Tomb's underground palace.
sentences.chinese: 四方城是明孝陵地下宮城的象徵性城樓。

definition: Dr Sun Yat-sen's mausoleum in Nanjing
Linggu temple (Nanjing)
the Ming tombs (mausoleum park of the Ming emperors in Changping district of Beijing)
Purple Mountain in suburbs of Nanjing, with Ming tombs and Sun Yat-sen's mausoleum

Confucian temple
Humble Administrator's Garden in Suzhou, Jiangsu
Jingshan Park (park in Beijing)
Jingshan (name of a hill in Jingshan park)
cemetery/mausoleum park
tomb (of king or emperor)
to pay homage at a mausoleum
Huqiu district of Suzhou city 蘇州市|苏州市[Su1 zhou1 shi4], Jiangsu
Gyeongbokgung palace in central Seoul
